alert.note: Alert for Ventura County Beaches (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 08 at 2:04PM PST until January 12 at 3:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM WEDNESDAY TO 3 AM PST FRIDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM TO NOON PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 4 to 7 feet Wednesday and 6 to 8 feet with local max sets to 9 feet Thursday. Dangerous rip currents are likely. Surf highest on west-facing beaches. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. * WHERE...Ventura County Beaches. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 9 AM Wednesday to 3 AM PST Friday. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 4 AM to noon PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of sea water is likely, around the time of high tide, over vulnerable low-lying coastal areas such as parking lots, beaches, and walkways. Significant damage to roads or structures is NOT expected. There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Morning high tide Thursday is predicted to be near 7.3 feet at around 830 AM.
info.instruction: Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Do NOT drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Rock jetties can be deadly in such conditions, stay off the rocks.
